casebody.data:
[L. A. No. 1823. Department Two. May 13, 1907.] JUNIPERO LAND AND WATER COMPANY (a Corporation), Plaintiff and Respondent, v. A. F. CORNELL et al., Defendants and Appellants. FIDELITY TRUST COMPANY (a Corporation), Plaintiff and Respondent, v. A. F. CORNELL et al., Defendants and Appellants. TERRENO COMPANY (a Corporation), Plaintiff and Respondent, v. A. F. CORNELL et al., Defendants and Appellants. *199SAN DIEGO INVESTMENT COMPANY (a Corporation), Plaintiff and Respondent, v. A. F. CORNELL et al., Defendants and Appellants. CITIZENS’ BANK OF LOS ANGELES (a Corporation), Plaintiff and Respondent, v. A. F. CORNELL et al., Defendants and Appellants. CARLSON INVESTMENT COMPANY (a Corporation), Plaintiff and Respondent, v. A. F. CORNELL et al., Defendants and Appellants. *198[L. A. No. 1824.] [L. A. No. 1825.] *199[L. A. No. 1826.] [L. A. No. 1827.] [L. A. No. 1828.] Taxation—Void Description op Property—Injunction to Restrain Deed to State—Payment op Tax as Condition to Injunction.— San Diego Realty Co. v. A. F. Cornell, ante, p. 197, affirmed, and judgments ordered modified in accordance therewith. APPEALS from judgments of the Superior Court of San Diego County. E. S. Torrence, Judge. The facts are stated in the opinion in Scm Diego Realty Company v. Cornell, ante, p. 197.

Cassius Carter, and Albert Schoonover, for Appellants.

Collier, Smith & Holcomb, for Respondents.

THE COURT.

The judgments herein are ordered modified in accordance with San Diego Realty Co. v. Cornell, L. A. No. 1805, ante, p. 197, [90 Pac. 1130], wherein an opinion is this day filed.
